title: 8 WTF Pieces of Art at Yale
author: Diane Kim
text:
While Yale is known for its Gothic architecture, it also has a surprising number of modern art randomly scattered all over campus. Other than my occasional thoughts of “wtf is that”, these art pieces never really affected my life. Then, more and more appeared. A sculpture would pop up on my way to work, when I get out of section, when I get froyo with a friend. Like, how did they get here? Who made them? What do they even mean?

1. Let’s start with this this new addition on Cross Campus. Is it just me or does this have an uncanny resemblance to Olaf? Here’s a side-by-side comparison:



2. Spotted at JE: No matter which angle I look at it, it just looks so sexual. . .



3. The plaque reads: “Scrap Metal and More Scrap Metal, with Flowers.”



4. Is the tank too small or the lipstick too big? Someone at Morse/Stiles needs to explain this to me because I’m not getting it.



6. Even our buildings are starting to look abstract.



7. Maybe it has something to do with biology? All I see is a face with a lumpy chin.



8. Okay, I think I got this: it’s obviously a hula hoop with a tail.
summary: While Yale is known for its Gothic architecture, it also has a surprising number of modern art randomly scattered all over campus.
